summary: This document is an email chain from February 2020 within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing nominations for the Attorney General's Awards. It includes a nomination for the prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein, providing a summary of the case, the charges, his arrest, and his death. The email also outlines the nomination process and schedule.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the prosecution being nominated for an award. He is described as a heinous and prolific abuser of minors, charged with sex trafficking and conspiracy.

persons.name: Richard Berman
persons.context: Presided over the bail argument for Jeffrey Epstein, resulting in Epstein's detention pending trial.

persons.name: John McEnany
persons.context: Sent the initial email requesting nominations for the Attorney General's Awards and outlined the submission schedule.

persons.name: Luke U.
persons.context: Mentioned as a recipient for the final nomination packages for review.

connections.description: Judge Berman presided over Epstein's bail hearing, ordering his detention pending trial.

events.title: Start of Epstein's Abuse
events.description: Epstein began enticing and recruiting dozens of minor girls to engage in sex acts with him, paying them hundreds of dollars in cash.

events.title: Florida Investigation and Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Epstein was investigated by the Southern District of Florida, resulting in a non-prosecution agreement and a state conviction for underage prostitution. He served 13 months in prison, some on work release.

events.title: SDNY Indictment
events.description: A federal grand jury in the SDNY returned a sealed indictment charging Epstein with one count of sex trafficking of minors and one count of conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Epstein was arrested upon his return to the U.S. at Teterboro airport after traveling abroad from his estate in the U.S. Virgin Islands.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Epstein committed suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) while detained pending trial.

locations: Southern District of New York (SDNY), One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The SDNY prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein took only 7 months from inception to charges, with efforts to keep the investigation covert due to his flight risk.
Epstein's abuse scheme involved recruiting minor girls as young as 14 for 'massages' that escalated to sexual acts, and he paid victims hundreds of dollars in cash per encounter.
Epstein encouraged some victims to recruit other girls, creating a vast network of underage victims, and paid these recruiters for each new girl they brought.
Epstein was arrested on July 6, 2019, after being indicted while abroad, and was detained pending trial following a bail hearing before Judge Richard Berman.
Epstein died by suicide in his cell at the MCC on August 10, 2019, before his trial could conclude.
